results.title: Time and place
results.creator_credit: Phillip Mark-Law, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A study of our living environment in all its variety. Capturing the mood of today’s living, grasping at images of a graceful, more leisurely past, and examining alternative paths into the future. Without commentary, this deeply perceptive film establishes a basis for comparison of environmental situations, and asks the viewer to make their own choice. Begins with the documentation of Christo’s wrapping of the Sydney cove coastline (shot through a rose coloured lens in the final scenes).

results.title: Timber town
results.creator_credit: Oliver Howes, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Looks at life in a timber town located in the hardwood forest area of the southwestern coast of Western Australia. Shows Karri forests, tree felling, reforestation, controlled burning of undergrowth, timber hauling and milling. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Three To Go: Toula
results.creator_credit: Oliver Howes, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Part of a trilogy concerning the problems of young people in Australia. Toula is a girl in a Greek migrant family living in a Greek community in Sydney. She wants desperately to be a young, modern Australian, but she loves her parents and they demand a different way of life. In spite of family difference, gradually Toula and her brother establish a blend of Greek and Australian, bi-lingual and bi-social, which provides a certain amount of satisfaction for all concerned.

results.title: Three to go: Michael
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Part of a trilogy concerning the problems of young people in Australia. Michael has to make decisions in the complex but permissive world of today. His friends have followed a relatively straight and narrow path of conformity. Michael has more or less taken this course, but knows that other ways exist. He is prepared to listen to the prophets of change and revolution and is taken on an excursion into the world of the young radical. In which world does Michael belong? Features Grahame Bond. Also available on DVD [319174].

results.title: Three to go: Judy
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Brian Hannant and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Part of a trilogy concerning the problems of young people in Australia. Judy is a young girl who lives in a large provincial city. Like most girls of her age, she longs to get out and see life, to find the fun, romance and adventure. She wants to go to the big city to work. The film shows the last few weeks before she leaves home. We meet her parents, workmates and boy friend. In their comments we discover some of the problems a teenage girl has to face when living in a large country town.

results.title: 3 dances - Gulpilil
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Tom Manefield, Commonwealth Department of Aboriginal Affairs and Film Australia
results.brief_description: David Gulpilil performs three Aboriginal dances, Emu, Kangaroo and Fish. The first two are solo performances by Gulpilil and are closer to mime than dance. The third is a group dance with some of the children from Bamyili where Gulpilil lives in the Northern Territory.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Roberts, Tom Manefield, Commonwealth Department of Aboriginal Affairs and Film Australia

results.title: This is the ABC
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Madeleine Williams and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A survey of Australia’s national radio network and the programs it provides. The network consists of transmitters in the metropolitan areas of the Commonwealth; regional relay transmitters and Radio Australia. The ABC broadcasts a total of 1000 hours of programs every day in the year (1954); various departments compile these programs - News, Sporting, Talks, School Broadcasts etc. The film includes behind-the-scene shots of such programs as Dr Floyd’s Music Lovers’ Hour, Kindergarten of the Air, The Country Hour, Blue Hills and The Village Glee Club. Compered by Rupert Chance.

results.title: These sharks need protection
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The need for conservation of the edible sharks which are fished off the south coast of Australia has been proved by scientific observation.

results.title: Tempo: Australia in the 70's
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Richard Brennan, David Haythornthwaite, Keith Gow, Roland Beckett and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Impressions of life and industry in Australia, emphasising growth and development. The emphasis is on the great potential for growth and economic development in the 1970’s. Also involved in the production are Peter Weir who co-wrote the script with Keith Gow and Mick Von Borneman as Director of photography.
